ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Surnames
ygData.msgSnippet: Nah, if you wanted your first name changed, I m sure you d have to pony up the 50 bucks for it. The only free first names changes that I know of are, again,
ygData.messageBody:
Nah, if you wanted your first name changed, I'm sure
you'd have to pony up the 50 bucks for it.

The only free first names changes that I know of are,
again, due to naming violations. My husbands necro got
away with being called Saatan for quite a while until
he had to petition about some other problem. When the
GM contacted him about his problem, before the
conversation was over he said "And about that name..."
hehe. GM at least allowed him to pick a new first
name. :)

--- Kent King <propellerheadus@...> wrote:
> I wish I had spelled Quwi Changkane as "Quai
> Changkane" personally. I did not know the proper
> spelling until I saw one of his Wanted posters on an
> old rerun of Kung Fu last year, doh.
>
> I don't think a petition for a first name change
> would
> work, so I've never tried. I grabbed that name
> pre-Kunark and I'll bet most 4 letter names are gone
> at this point.
>
> Oh well... Quwi was a good shot at it phonetically
> :)
>
> Quwi
>
>


=====
~~~~~~~~~

And on the eighth day God said, "O.K. Murphy. You take over."
